result.execSummary:
The defendant Amber R. Berg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - County/Municipality [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments]. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amber R. Berg

records.addlTxt: from Clerk to Defendant re: CAA bill
Attorney fees in the amount of $222.00 for Attorney Susan Meade.
Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant.

9:26 AM Defendant Amber R. Berg in court.  Attorney Susan M Meade in court for Amber R. Berg.  Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for State of Wisconsin. There is an agreement. State is not in compliance with victim notification requirements.

Plea Hearing: 09/29/22 at 9:30am

RECALLED: 9:36am Same appearances. State confirms compliance with victim notification requirements. Count 1 is amended to a County Disorderly Conduct with the Domestic Abuse Assessment. Court accepts plea and finds the defendant guilty. Court orders costs and surcharges.

Attorney Susan Meade at $100/hr.  Defendant shall reimburse Eau Claire County by making payments of $100 beginning 08/05/2022 and every 30 days thereafter.  Payment shall not exceed the full cost of representation.

records.addlTxt:
10:14 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Amber R. Berg in court without counsel. 
State recites the offer. Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 7/25/22 at 2:30 pm.
Hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.
CK 43937 mailed to defendant; signature bond ordered, bail refunded.

(Case called at 11:58 AM) Defendant Amber Berg appears in person without counsel. ADA Matthew Kirkpatrick appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 06/20/2022 at 1:45 PM. 
Hearing: 07/06/2022 at 9:30 AM.

Conditions:
No acts or threats of violence against anyone.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
